OBJECTIVE Description Reference
OBJECTIVE 4-1 Explain the importance of information in gaining insights about the marketplace and customers. Marketing Information and Customer Insights (pp 124–126)
OBJECTIVE 4-2 Define the marketing information system and discuss its parts. Assessing Information Needs and Developing Data (pp 126–130)
OBJECTIVE 4-3 Outline the steps in the marketing research process. Marketing Research (pp 130–140)
OBJECTIVE 4-4 Explain how companies analyze and use marketing information. Analyzing and Using Marketing Information (pp 140–144)
OBJECTIVE 4-5 Discuss the special issues some marketing researchers face, including public policy and ethics issues. Other Marketing Information Considerations (pp 144–149)
summary_markdown: This table outlines five key learning objectives related to marketing information and customer insights. It begins by emphasizing the significance of information for understanding the marketplace and customers (Objective 4-1). It then defines the marketing information system and its components (Objective 4-2). The subsequent objective details the steps involved in the marketing research process (Objective 4-3). Following this, the table addresses how companies analyze and utilize the gathered marketing information (Objective 4-4). Finally, it highlights specific challenges faced by marketing researchers, such as public policy and ethical considerations (Objective 4-5). The structure progresses from the foundational importance of information to the practical aspects of research, analysis, and ethical considerations, providing a comprehensive overview of the topic.
